title: Can you solve the rogue submarine riddle? Difficulty level: Master - Alex Rosenthal

multiple-choice.question: What was the main problem the protagonist faced after hacking into the nuclear missile launch override?

options.label: A
options.text: Finding the location of the submarine

multiple-choice.question: What information did the big boss give to Minion A and Minion B?

options.label: A
options.text: The full launch code to both minions

options.label: B
options.text: One launch code to Minion A and the other to Minion B

options.label: C
options.text: The same launch code to both minions

options.label: D
options.text: No launch code to either minion

multiple-choice.question: What did Minion A say to Minion B after the boss revealed the relationship between their launch codes?

options.label: B
options.text: "I don't know whether you know my number."

multiple-choice.question: What did Minion B respond to Minion A's statement?

options.label: B
options.text: "I know your number, but not the override code."

options.label: C
options.text: "I know your number, and now I know you know my number too."

multiple-choice.question: What was the key insight gained from Minion A's first statement?

options.label: A
options.text: Minion B knew Minion A's number

options.label: B
options.text: Minion A knew Minion B's number

options.label: C
options.text: The only scenarios where Minion B could know Minion A's number are when there's exactly one valid way to factor Minion B's number

options.label: D
options.text: The launch codes were not related

multiple-choice.question: What were the possible numbers that Minion A could have, based on Minion A's first statement?
Why were 3 and 4 eliminated as possible numbers for Minion A?

options.label: C
options.text: Because if the sum was either, the product could only be 2 or 3, in which case Minion A would know that Minion B already knows Minion A's number

options.label: D
options.text: Because they were not prime numbers

multiple-choice.question: What were the possible products that Minion B could have, based on Minion A's number being 5?
Why was the option of Minion A's number being 6 eliminated?

options.label: A
options.text: Because it would mean Minion B's number was 5

options.label: B
options.text: Because it would mean Minion B's number was 8

options.label: C
options.text: Because it would mean Minion A would still not know whether Minion B had 5 or 8, contradicting the second half of Minion B's statement

options.label: D
options.text: Because it would mean Minion B's number was 4

multiple-choice.question: What were the correct override codes?

title: You could have a secret twin (but not the way you think) - Kayla Mandel Sheets

multiple-choice.question: What condition was discovered in Karen Keegan, where an individual has two genomes present in the tissues of their body?
Where did the second set of genes in Karen Keegan's body come from?

options.label: C
options.text: Her twin sister who had never been born

multiple-choice.question: What is one way that chimerism can occur?
What happens to the fetal stem cells that a mother inherits during pregnancy?

options.label: A
options.text: They are immediately destroyed by the mother's immune system

options.label: B
options.text: They can persist in the mother's body for years or even decades

options.label: C
options.text: They are only found in the placenta

options.label: D
options.text: They are only found in the fetus

multiple-choice.question: What was discovered in a mother's liver that had started to regenerate itself?

options.label: C
options.text: DNA from a pregnancy almost 20 years earlier

multiple-choice.question: How did Karen Keegan acquire her second genome?

options.label: A
options.text: Through a tissue or organ transplant

multiple-choice.question: What can happen to individuals with chimerism?

options.label: A
options.text: They may have two-toned skin or hair

options.label: B
options.text: They may have two different colored eyes

options.label: C
options.text: They may have no visible signs of the condition

multiple-choice.question: What percentage of the father's sperm carried a second genome from an embryonic twin in a 2014 study?
How many individual births are estimated to have started out as twin pregnancies?
What do cases of chimerism challenge?

title: Earth's mysterious red glow, explained - Zoe Pierrat

multiple-choice.question: In 2009, a satellite scanning the Earth's surface discovered an unexpected wavelength of unknown origin, which was later found to be associated with:
What is the primary way that plants use light to grow?

options.label: B
options.text: By radiating it back out at a different wavelength

options.label: D
options.text: By absorbing it without any reaction

multiple-choice.question: What is the byproduct of photosynthesis that is essential for life on Earth?
Why do plants need to transform excess light into heat and dissipate it out of their leaves?

options.label: B
options.text: To protect their photosynthetic machinery from damage

multiple-choice.question: What is the term for the process by which plants radiate excess light back out at a different wavelength?
What percentage of the light absorbed by plants is re-emitted as wavelengths at the red end of the spectrum?
What was the accidental discovery made by researchers using satellite data?

options.label: A
options.text: The Earth's oceans are absorbing more carbon dioxide

options.label: B
options.text: The Earth's forests are producing more oxygen

options.label: C
options.text: The Earth has a baffling red glow due to chlorophyll fluorescence

options.label: D
options.text: The Earth's deserts are expanding at an alarming rate

multiple-choice.question: Why is tracking chlorophyll fluorescence from space useful for monitoring ecosystem health?

options.label: A
options.text: It provides a direct measure of plant growth

options.label: B
options.text: It provides a direct measure of photosynthetic activity

options.label: C
options.text: It provides a direct measure of carbon dioxide levels

options.label: D
options.text: It provides a direct measure of oxygen levels

multiple-choice.question: What is one potential application of tracking chlorophyll fluorescence from space?

options.label: A
options.text: Monitoring the effects of climate change on polar ice caps

options.label: B
options.text: Monitoring the health of coral reefs

options.label: C
options.text: Monitoring the effects of drought on plant growth

options.label: D
options.text: Monitoring the migration patterns of animals

multiple-choice.question: What is one advantage of using chlorophyll fluorescence as a measure of plant health compared to traditional methods?

options.label: C
options.text: It can detect changes in plant health before visible signs of stress appear
